instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: 2011 mbp <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Pink screen w/Boot sound
threads.message:
Hey all,
Got brought a dead MBP, client states he brought it in for maintenance a few years ago to another shop. After a year, he says it didn't power on randomly, so he pulled the bottom case and said that he found a screw floating around in the system on the mobo. Says he kept it for another year, decided to try and charge it randomly - when it gave the boot sound but no video.

(Before repairs preformed so far, there was no screen image or backlight) System fans and disk power up once for about 6 seconds, then off for about 5 then on again until I power it down. No screen or boot chime for the first cycle.

To the jucie details. <TRANSISTOR>Q9560</TRANSISTOR> was welded to the mobo. [ATTACH alt="Click image for larger version  Name:	<SIGNAL>S20171205_0001</SIGNAL>.jpg Views:	1 Size:	309.7 KB ID:	28896"]28896._xfImport[/ATTACH] Repealed [ATTACH alt="Click image for larger version  Name:	<SIGNAL>S20171205_0002</SIGNAL>.jpg Views:	1 Size:	305.0 KB ID:	28898"]28897._xfImport[/ATTACH] that's working fine now.

Wasn't getting any voltage on pin 4 (gate), figured that whatever got in, went out to <CHIP>U9500</CHIP>. Replaced and now im getting a strong 1.52V on my <SIGNAL>PP1V5_GPU_REG</SIGNAL>.
I'm getting a pink or purple screen, after pram reset a white screen once. "image" looks torn or what I would imagine from a dead gpu.

Reistance from P1 on L9560 (<SIGNAL>GPU_REG</SIGNAL>) is 0.9 ohm or in diode mode 0.001 dead short. <CHIP>U8500</CHIP> and <CHIP>U8550</CHIP> get burning flesh hot after seconds of on time.... Do I have some bad ram or a shot GPU? or both...

Opinions (with some explinations?)

Im going to guess, that what ever took out <TRANSISTOR>Q9560</TRANSISTOR> was pretty hard and did something to the PP1V5 that would take out the <CHIP>U8500</CHIP> and <CHIP>U8550</CHIP> and potentially the GPU, but I havn't had experience with this before.

Next move to pull <CHIP>U8500</CHIP> and <CHIP>U8550</CHIP> to see if the short disappears?

Thanks and happy repairs!

threads.title: 2011 mbp <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Pink screen w/Boot sound
threads.message: [h=2]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, always the gpu[/h]

threads.title: 2011 mbp <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Pink screen w/Boot sound
threads.message:
Like ielectron said, if its not the GPU now it will be tomorrow.

but <TRANSISTOR>Q9560</TRANSISTOR> is the high driver mosfet for <SIGNAL>PP1V5_GPU_REG</SIGNAL> so it probably killed the GPU anyways

threads.title: 2011 mbp <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Pink screen w/Boot sound
threads.message: Yeah this is trash, probably dead GPU and VRAM by now.

threads.title: 2011 mbp <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Pink screen w/Boot sound
threads.message: Alright, thanks guys! - For future reference for a quick sheet - What models should I be weary of? MBP 2011-2013 15" or all sizes?

threads.title: 2011 mbp <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Pink screen w/Boot sound
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and 2915, 2011 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> models are the ones with the shit GPUs.
